meanings.definition: The theory that the self is the only thing that can be known to exist.
meanings.sent1: In solipsism, one believes that only their own existence is certain.
meanings.sent2: Some philosophers explore the concept of solipsism in depth.
meanings.sent3: When discussing solipsism, it can lead to interesting debates.
meanings.sent4: The idea of solipsism can feel like being trapped in a bubble of self-awareness.
meanings.sent5: Solipsism can make one feel isolated from the rest of the world.

meanings.definition: The belief that only one's own mind is sure to exist.
meanings.sent1: Solipsism challenges the idea of a shared reality.
meanings.sent2: She struggled with the concept of solipsism during her philosophy class.
meanings.sent3: His extreme solipsism sometimes made him forget about others' perspectives.
meanings.sent4: Living in solipsism is like being the only character in a dream.
meanings.sent5: The notion of solipsism can be both intriguing and unsettling.
